boardgame.name: Colonisation
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Dark Stars Colonies Book, a setting and supplement for the Dark Stars Role Playing Game. To use this book, you will need the Dark Stars CORE book. Other books including Off the Rack and the Corporations book are fully compatible with this book. If you found this book through the FWB setting and game, this is also compatible with the Equipment list in FWB.

»» BIG TOOLBOX FOR RUNNING CAMPAIGNS IN SPACE WITH COLONIES

»» GENERATION SYSTEMS FOR WORLDS, ECOSYSTEMS, ORGANISMS

»» NEW EQUIPMENT & VEHICLES.

»» CAMPAIGN SEEDS FOR A COLONISATION CAMPAIGN

boardgame.name: Wagram 1809: Formation Command #1
boardgame.description:
Wagram 1809 is the first in a series of games designed to place an emphasis upon command at the individual formation level. Formations will be Corps in this game.

The Formation Command system requires both players to make a series of difficult battlefield decisions, usually with insufficient resources available.
This gets achieved through a unique Command system using Formation cards which will retain information about Cohesion (which affects Morale), Commands given and the readiness of Formations to fulfill actions required.
If the wrong Commands are issued at the start of the turn, the player will not be able to 'change course' during the turn, but will have to live with the consequences.

This will keep the map as clean and uncluttered as possible, because a lot of the action is going on ‘off board’. There will only be, at most, three counters per hex (excluding Leader)– maximum of 2 units plus a morale status marker.

The activation sequence of formations will be determined by a chit draw mechanic, although players are able to make choices about which exact formation to activate in most cases.

This, and the possibility for the passive player to conduct a range of five different reaction actions, lets both players be actively involved at all times.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tales From The Block
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Block, a mega structure grown on the surface of Mars. So huge, that five hundred million teeming masses make their home there. Tales from the Block is the first Dark Stars Scenario Book. Packed with three large scenarios, all the NPC’s laid out and information about the history, the locations and the ecology of this Corporate Archology.

90+ Non-Player Characters
150 Pages of Scenarios, locations, history and content
Maps of the major scenario locations.

boardgame.name: Faeries Wear Boots!: Original
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“The carnival had been dark for decades; the smell of garbage and failed endeavour pervaded the place. Sitting on a fence the pixie eyed the mortal with a curious look. The elf woman, in tartan skirt and safety pins approached, in an instant he would forget he ever saw them, forget that the riot they saved him from was a cover for darker forces at work in Thatcher’s Britain. In this world, Fairies exist, and they wear Doc Martins.”

In this game the players play Faerie Punks working against the oppressive fascist regime of the British government. Transport yourself in a past un-remembered where you can be the force of change.

What’s in this book

♦ Rules for Playing Faeries Wear Boots! in the 1980s complete conversion.
♦ English Setting,
♦ 10 Faeries.
♦ Monsters, which have made it to the modern era.
♦ 1980s equipment.

A Roleplaying Game about Faerie Punks against the Establishment. Part of the Dark Stars Universe of Games. This is a complete role playing game with rules, monsters and setting information.

boardgame.name: Faeries Wear Boots!: The Age of Gods
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement for Faeries Wear Boots ushers in the rules for playing Dark Gritty low fantasy using the Dark Stars system. Dark Stars is ideally suited to creating historic settings and we strive as game designers to provide a balance of realism alongside well tested playable rules and a simple system.

What in this book
♦ Rules for Playing Dark Stars in the Age of Gods, complete conversion.
♦ Mythic Earth Setting.
♦ 10 Faeries and 6 new Faeries including Demi Gods.
♦ New NPC's and Monsters including Cyclopes, Centaurs and Hydra.
♦ System of Divinity and Human Priests being granted magic from Faeries
♦ System for Thaumaturgy, human faerie like magic through rituals
♦ Circa 5000BC-100 A.D Equipment and Crafting.

boardgame.name: Faeries Wear Boots!: Age of Inquisition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement for Faeries Wear Boots ushers in the rules for playing Dark Gritty low fantasy using the Dark Stars system. Dark Stars is ideally suited to creating historic settings and we strive as game designers to provide a balance of realism alongside well tested playable rules and a simple system. This book is packed full of source material for Renaissance era role playing, including ships, cannon and magic.

What in this book

♦ Rules for Playing Faeries Wear Boots! in the Age of Inquisition, complete conversion.
♦ This is the Age of Piracy! new ships are provided Ships.
♦ Mythic Earth Setting English & European Setting.
♦ 12 Faeries.
♦ Many new monsters and monster templates.
♦ System for Demons, outsiders from Beyond the realms of man and Faerie.
♦ Circa 1300 to 1700 A.D Equipment and Crafting including early firearms.

boardgame.name: Beyond the Gates of Antares: The Chryseis Shard
boardgame.description:
The Chryseis Shard - The Ascent of the Locus - describes events taking place in Antarean space since the destruction of the planet Xilos as portrayed in the first Antares supplement The Battle for Xilos.

At the conclusion of that adventure, the discovery of an unborn Builder Gate and its subsequent escape from stasis consumed the planet Xilos and unleashed a new and terrifying power into the Antarean nexus.

Full Campaign. You can play out the entire campaign of six battles using the forces described. Each side’s total score gives it an individual success rating. The score accumulated by the Locus gives a bonus level in the final game, making the Locus easier or harder to defeat.

Modified Campaign. You can also play out the entire campaign of six battles using any forces chosen to an appropriate points value as indicated for each game. You might also reduce the number of battles by just playing the ones that appeal to you.

Narrative Scenarios. You can play any of the six individual scenarios in this book using any forces you wish in the same way as the narrative scenarios already included in the Beyond the Gates of Antares rulebook. Individual scenarios can be played over and over again, with different forces every time if you want. Notes are also included suggesting further variations to try out.

Army List Entries. This book contains additions for existing army lists that either extend existing entries or add new ones. Although introduced here for the first time, these new entries form part of the relevant army lists and can be used in any Antares games. Your Free PDF army lists will be up dated soon!

Characters. Rules for several new Antarean characters that can be used in any games on the same basis as other Antarean characters.

Chryseian Armoury. An introduction to new weaponry and new equipment including a selection of vehicles as well as new squad types for Algoryn and Isorians.

New Variant Forces. This book includes new rules covering drop forces, new force selectors that allow different combinations of troop types, and rules for Ghar Fifth Columnists!

Hazardous Environments. A selection of new rules for fighting in hazardous environments.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dark Stars is ideally suited to creating historic settings and we strive as game designers to provide a balance of realism alongside well tested playable rules and a simple system.

boardgame.name: Beyond The Black Sea
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book is a complete game using the Dark Stars rules system.
Beyond the Black Sea is a gritty, low fantasy game set before the times of the gods. 10,000 BC is the age of adventure, with much of the world containing very small populations of people. This mythic Earth ushers in a fantasy Earth setting based on the Golden Age of Sword & Sorcery. Barbarians, primitives, priests and monsters plot in a dangerous and violent world of strange creatures and ancient mystery.

What's in this book

♦ Rules for playing Sword & Sorcery fantasy
♦ Mythic Earth setting with Middle Eastern, Tamazghan & European setting information
♦ Detailed mythic setting with ancient histories and other sentient species
♦ Many new monsters and monster templates
♦ System for circa 10,000 BC equipment and crafting

boardgame.name: Beyond The Black Sea Bestiary
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book is the Bestiary source book for Beyond the Black Sea, the book is compatible with all the Dark Stars rule system books. The creatures and backgrounds are primarily from the Faeries Wear Boots! Setting, but these could be adapted to any setting.

Beyond the Black Sea Setting
10,000 BC is the age of adventure, with much of the world containing very small populations of people. This mythic Earth ushers in a fantasy Earth setting based on the Golden Age of Sword & Sorcery. Barbarians, primitives, priests and monsters plot in a dangerous and violent world of strange creatures and ancient mystery.

What's in this book
♦ 220 pages of Monsters & Animals for Beyond the Black Sea
♦ Completly compatible with all of the Dark Stars systems
♦ Monster Templates which can enhance the monsters & animals to provide unique and new challenges
♦ More monster and animal based Perks, which be added to any other monster or character

boardgame.name: Vulcania Quickstart
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vulcania is a tabletop role-playing game full of action, conspiracies, and investigation, set in the smoky atmospheres of the industrial revolution of a Fantasy - Steampunk world.

Here's a taste of what will "Vulcania - A steampunk role-playing game" offer. Included are an overview of the rules, five pre-generated characters and an introductory adventure to dive into the world of Vulcania!


User note: Despite the description being in English, the current PDF is in Italian

boardgame.name: Vulcania: The Shadow of the Squid
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"The Shadow of the Squid" is the second episode of the Xhuul saga started with "The Usual Suspects", the adventure contained in Vulcania's basic manual.

After recovering professor Kordon’s journal and risking their hides in an aerial battle, the Characters are brought to the seat of the Hornmule, faced with a key decision. Will they join the organization or return to their lives? Whatever path they take, the Characters will cross paths with the Xhuul threat again, facing a danger that could change the fate of the entire world!

boardgame.name: Excalibur (Year 2, Issue 6 - Oct 1992)
boardgame.description: 48 pages + 16 pages (detachable adventures insert)

boardgame.name: Excalibur (Year 2, Issue 7 - Dec 1992)
boardgame.description: 48 pages + 32 pages (detachable adventures insert)

boardgame.name: DBM Naval Rules
boardgame.description:
Rule modifications and naval lists designed for the simple but satisfying resolution of fleet sized naval battles.

Although these rules are grounded on the existing naval aspects of DBM, they are in no way intended as a replacement for the existing rule mechanics used in the land game. Instead the aim has been to create a set of rules appropriate for purely naval battles.

The rules and naval lists have been written with a very specific period in mind, namely 240BC to 167BC. This is the period from the end of the First Punic War to the final Roman destruction of the Macedonian monarchy.

But the rules might be accommodated with further modifications right through the 15th century and beyond.

—description from the introduction (extracted)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: De Bellis Multitudinis: Wargames Rules for Ancient and Medieval Battles – 3000 BC to 1500 AD

boardgame.name: Ravin' Under Dark
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Over the course of several journeys, you've caught whispered references to a mysterious figure known as "DJ Ishkremshüz." In out of the way spots, you've seen graffiti of a stylized ice cream cone, and picked up DIY flyers advertising a secret, never-ending party.

You’ve asked around at back-alley tea shops and street-side record vendors. What you’ve discovered is that DJ Shooz is real, a legendary underground turntablist, and that he presides over a massive dance party so underground, it’s literally subterranean.

Ravin' Under Dark is a free, unofficial scenario for Ryuutama that takes travelers into a perilous underground world, developed through twenty encounters, which can be played, dropped, or randomly chosen at the GM's discretion. Also included are rules for managing illumination in the Underground, and several new monsters like the Üntergoblins -- a race of Nekogoblins endemic to this lightless world.

boardgame.name: James M Spahn's Skaldic Sagas: Heroic Journeys in the Viking Age
Skaldic Sagas: Heroic Journeys in the Viking Age
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the Fury of the Northmen, Deliver us

Skaldic Sagas: Heroic Journeys in the Viking Age is a roleplaying game rooted in the mythopoetic and cultural traditions of what is now called the Viking Age. Blending the history and the heroism found in the verses of Poetic Edda, Prose Edda, and Beowulf, it tells stories rooted in real-world mythology and archaeology to serve as a vehicle for telling your own stories where kin and community are as important as battle and bloodshed.  

Though a complete stand-alone game, Skaldic Sagas' is compatible with The Hero's Journey Fantasy Roleplaying, Second Edition.

boardgame.name: Valor Knights: The Electrocube War
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Valor Knights is a complete RPG in a zine format. VK uses a hybrid combination of The Black Hack by David Black and The Blackest of Deaths Game System by Eric Bloat. Its fast, loose and a ton of fun to play; A perfect game to emulate the over the top 80s cartoon tropes and adventures that we remember and love.

Rules included:

Core Mechanic
Hindrance & Benefit
Advantage & Disadvantage
Attributes (Strength, Intelligence, Wisdom, Dexterity, Constitution and Charisma)
Determining Attributes, Luck
Hit Points, Hit Dice, Healing and Death
Evade & Armor Points, Damage Points
Leveling Up
Everything in Turn, Initiative, Time & Turns
Movement & Distances (Close, Near, Far, Distant)
Shifting
Character Creation
Character Classes (Leader, Warrior, Support, Mini-Bot)
Weapons & Equipment
Valor Knights vs Chaos Lords

boardgame.name: Champions of the Electrocube War
Champions of the Electrocube War Volume 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you like cars who are also robots? Do you like over the top cartoons from the 80s?

Then you need to check out Valor Knights from Bloat Games.

And - you need this book - which gives you a handful of heroic and villainous characters for your Valor Knights game - rendered by fan favorite artist Jacob Blackmon.

ALSO - Includes new rules for Valor Knights for Gestalt robots.

boardgame.name: Champions of the Electrocube War Volume 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This pdf contains a new batch of heroes and (mainly) villains for the Valor Knights RPG rendered by fan favorite artist Jacob Blackmon.

Thanks again to Eric Bloat for writing the it and for his very generous Hack the RPG program which makes it possible for us to create our own supplements for that.

We've got our versions of a couple of Eric’s characters from VK in here: Ultra-Bomber and Sonic Assault!

For the busy GM, this pdf also contains a table of sample ideas for adventures you can play in the world of the Electrocube War.

boardgame.name: Puzzle Quest: The Legend Returns
boardgame.description: A remaster/expansion of the original Puzzle Quest: Challenge of the Warlords including Revenge of the Plaguelord expansion and an all new Attack of the Golem expansion. - written by Bowman21
boardgame.videogamecompilation: Puzzle Quest: Challenge of the Warlords

boardgame.name: EN5ider (Issue 334 - May 2020)
Multiclass Feats
boardgame.description:
EN5ider
Issue 334
Multiclass Feats

boardgame.name: Metahumans Rising
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When Super-science, Metahumans, and magic come together the possibilities are limitless. Create a rich comic book world uniquely your own. Protect the world from mad mutants, evil organizations bent on world domination, corrupt government groups that seek to control Metahumans or have them neutralized, and intergalactic conquerors seeking to harvest the Earth for their own reasons.

Using the Open Action System, players can create virtually any hero they can imagine. With guidelines for running individual heroes or creating their own world-class super team, the Open Action System is designed for fast, creative play that rewards characters for their backgrounds, talents, and creativity.

Build a shared super setting with guided collaborative world building and team origin, or jump into the action with the world of Metahumans Rising.
Create heroes with customizable arrays and flexible powers based on keywords, or pick from over 25 sample powers from absorption to water control, with hard light constructs and invulnerability in between.
Never feel limited to just what’s on the sheet as heroes push themselves beyond their limits with Willpower, a measure of one’s determination that grows as misfortunes mount and heroes struggle with their own motivations.
Easy to use rules for background characters and disasters allows GMs to create threats on the fly, from radioactive mutant gerbils to a tidal wave large enough to wipe out a country.
Find out about villainous organizations like Chimera, a genetic cult seeking to force start the next stage in human evolution, and the Bureau of Metahuman Affairs, a secretive arm of the US government tracking Metahuman activity worldwide.
Burning the Midnight Oil, an introductory adventure, gives you everything you need to get started, including: a story to help define a campaign city, a cadre of super villains known as the Brood and a sample starting super team, the Steel Aces.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Not Just Disadvantages - Driven to Excel

boardgame.name: The Burning Earth: Arena
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This micro-setting and adventure inspired by movies such as Death Race 2000, The Running Man, the Hunger Games books and movies, and comics such as 2000AD and Battle Angel Alita. Set in a post apocalyptic wasteland that pits Champions against one another in a series of blood sports where they hunt down lawless Exiles who live beyond the rule of Those Above.

Designed for Metahumans Rising, the setting forgoes the traditional superpowers for a gritty world of suffering and survival. The Burning Earth: Arena does not use the traditional character creation system. Instead, players use a life path to determine their Attributes, Talents, Boons, Fighting Style, and Gear. The Life Path generates characters on par with a Low Powered Hero. GMs may allow players to create traditional Low Powered characters.

Includes

Burning Earth setting with six unique regions
New Life Path character creation method designed for the Burning Earth
Three sample Arenas each with their own unique complications
A host of new threats and antagonists for use with the Burning Earth setting, but 100% compatable with the core Metahumans Rising game. Everything from Road gangs to gentically engineered monsters.

boardgame.name: Sabre Second Edition Sci Fi: Encounters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From simple street thugs to modern infantry, star knights and post-apocalytpic savages, the Encounters manual has them all! Inside you'll find 175 pre-built templates for npc's and vehicles, such as post-apocalytpic fighting machines, steampunk cars and dirigibles, modern tanks and attack helicopters, and high-speed fusion powered war machines of the future to challenge your players in a Sabre 2e Scifi game. This manual is ideal for quick improv games, and the templates can form the basis of your own designs!

There's also plenty of random looting tables from modern and high-tech eras for searching ruins, military bases, or just for a quick random loot roll. Saddle up!

boardgame.name: Victory & Alpha
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every story needs a beginning, and the hero of every story needs their origin story. While we may never learn the full truth of how superhuman powers came to exist in our world, we do know a great deal about the first two heroes of our times. Indeed, the first two humans to acquire super-powers are still alive, albeit retired. From what history tells us, the first human to acquire super-powers was Adam Cross, better known to the world first as Major Victory and eventually as Victory. He appeared on the public stage in the waning years of the 1950s. When people first saw proof of Victory’s abilities, they reacted in shock and fear to see a man who could fly, bend steel bars with his bare hands, and ignore tank shells striking him in the chest. Given the uncertainty of the time and the growing fear of “The Red Menace,” however, the public came to see Victory as their protector and a true patriot. Rather than act like some sort of demigod, he upheld the law, more importantly, never considered himself above the law. Here was an all-American hero people could cheer and support, secure in the knowledge they enjoyed an advantage over the rest of the world.

This PDF contains everything you need to know about the Strikeforce members, Victory & Alpha in the Amazing Universe Campaign or any other superhero campaign.
boardgame.rpgseries: Official Handbook of the Amazing Universe

boardgame.name: Savaged Pardners Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Western Pre-Gens!

This premiere edition of Savaged Pardners contains six (6) pre-generated Wild Card templates, ready for use in any Savage Worlds Western game, as well as a handful of Extra designs (4) to round things out.

The Wild Cards can be used by players as the heroes of an adventure, or they could become NPC adversaries – with the Extras tagging along one way or another. The Dog House Gang figures a Judge (that’s GM to city slickers) can put these characters to good use easy as pie.

Savaged Pardners is designed for use with the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition.

Vol. 1 includes six Seasoned rank Wild Cards, with six Advances each, and four Novice Extras with one Advance each.

Rifleman (WC)
Survivalist (WC)
Tin Star (WC)
Puglist (WC)
Charmer(WC)
Wrangler (WC)
Rough-Neck, Hardcase, Drover, Gun-Hand (Extras)

boardgame.name: Savaged Pardners Vol. 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Western Pre-Gens!

This second volume of Savaged Pardners contains six (6) pre-generated Wild Card templates, ready for use in any Savage Worlds Western game, along with four (4) Extra designs.

The Wild Cards can be used by players as the heroes of an adventure, or they could become NPC adversaries. The Extras can make an appearance on the trail or in town, as needed. The Dog House Gang figures a Judge (that’s GM to city slickers) can put these characters to good use without any difficulty.

Savaged Pardners is designed for use with the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition.

Savaged Pardners is designed for use with the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition.

Vol. 2 includes six Novice rank Wild Cards with three Advances each, and four Novice Extras with one Advance each.

Pistoleer (WC)
Sawbones (WC)
Mechanic (WC)
Knifefighter (WC)
Pinkerton (WC)
Gambler (WC)
Teamster, Hunter, Sodbuster, Shopkeeper (Extras)

boardgame.name: Forgotten Cave of the Serpentine God
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for six characters of levels 2-3

The poor village of Unsmore has seen its fair share of troubles. A year ago, they were saved by adventurers from the cult of the Serpentine God led by a naga. Just before the characters arrived in the village, it was raided by lizardfolk and several villagers were dragged away into the surrounding marshes.

The characters are recruited to save the missing villagers and track the lizardfolk to a forgotten cave once inhabited by the cult.

boardgame.name: Sagrada: Promo 12 – Tantrum House Window Pattern Card
boardgame.description:
Promotional card offered by the "Tantrum House Season 7 Kickstarter".

A new double sided player card to build the stained glass window in. Shuffle into the deck with the other player cards during setup and proceed as normal

listing.notes: Brand new Sagrada promo: Tantrum House Window pattern. Free shipping with tracking in the states.

NEW!
+Shipping
PayPal and Venmo payment preferred.
Brand New & Unplayed.
Shipping worldwide: 1,65 Please read Seller info below.

boardgame.name: Gatehouse on Cormac's Crag
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Swords & Wizardry adventure for 1st-3rd level characters....

The dilapidated keep on a windswept cliff has long been shunned by the local...so of course, that's where you are headed! Uncover secrets and explore the unknown as you attempt to rescue 3 helpless maidens.

A mini-mega 7 level dungeon filled with monsters, traps, tricks, and treasure, Gatehouse on Cormac's Crag is filled with classic old school goodness that will remind you of your earliest days of adventure. Characters are expected to make several forays from town to dungeon, healing, replacing hirelings, gaining experience, and forging thier tale Of heroism.

This adventure was compiled from a pile of the authors childhood maps and vague notes. These were from the days when the good stuff was created spontaneously by the DM and players, rather than overly detailed plots and railroad descriptions. I've attempted to give just enough hooks, information, and inspiration to get you playing, while leaving room for the true magic to happen during actual play.

...now, save vs. poison or die!

boardgame.name: Demon's Tilt
boardgame.description:
DEMON'S TILT is a tribute to ‘90s video pinball games, featuring modern effects and mechanics—including bosses, secrets, and unprecedented depth to please video gamers and hardcore pinball enthusiasts alike.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Sherlock Holmes: Chapter One
boardgame.description:
Sherlock Holmes: Chapter One is a story-driven detective thriller, where you play as a young Sherlock right at the start of his road to infamy. Young, reckless, and eager to prove himself, Sherlock takes on his first case as he navigates an exotic, dangerous island in the Mediterranean where he is investigating the mystery of his own mother’s death.

Sherlock Holmes: Chapter One is a complete and self-contained story.

boardgame.name: Délirium Quest
boardgame.description:
ADVENTURE GAME WITH DICE,
On your turn, you throw Dices (among 32 dice in a bag : 8 dices per color : blue, yellow, red, green). One more than players : 4 dices for 3 players.
You take On Dice to optimize your score paper and Try to make a road through the land with direction offer by your dice just taken. Your earn points by your the place of your dice and the longest of your road.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Werewizard!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A background for Troika!

Your dam tried to warn you that wizards were dangerous, but you were a young cub and found them fascinating.

boardgame.name: City Running Troika!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The City is bounded by the sea to the East, by the steppe-deserts and Great Wall to the South, by the unexplored mountains to the West, and by the Great Brown Wastes of the North that contain large deposits of metal, machinery, and ancient weapons.

boardgame.name: Space Troopers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 19 png. files of "Retro" Space Troopers for use with virtual tabletop programs. Also included are 4 rocket style ships inspired by "pulp" era stories.

boardgame.name: Darkest Africa
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 21 characters depicting the tribes of the Askaris, Masai and the Zulu nation, along with 9 animals of the African continent. Each file is roughly 480 x 480 pixels and 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: Royal Soldiers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Another set in the historical line of characters. 'Royal Soldiers' is a small representation of three of the nations vying for control of the Caribbean and the new world and to go along with the pirates token sets. Each file is roughly 480 x 480 pixels and 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: Wasteland Encounters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 20 creatures and robots from apocalyptic settings Each file is 480x 480 pixels and between 100 to 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: Wastelanders 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 20 characters of survivors from popular post apocalyptic settings Each file is 480x 480 pixels and between 100 to 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: Paleontologists
boardgame.description:
Paleontologists - A Roll-and-Write game

Overview: You are a paleontologist, trying to dig up the best fossils to earn the most points!
Items needed: 2 six-sided dice

The game is played over 20 rounds, with players playing simultaneously, trying to earn the most points by digging up fossils. All players will use the same dice pool for each roll, using the dice however each player determines.

Gameplay: Each Round you will roll 2 dice and then use those dice to draw a shape with a certain dig type on the dig site. You dig up a fossil when it is completely surrounded (orthogonally) by shapes you have drawn.

- Roll 2 dice - Roll the 2 dice. Write the numbers in the top right corner on the current round’s track. This is just used as a helpful reference. Of the two dice rolled, one will be used to determine which shape and the other die will be used to determine the type of dig.

- Use dice to choose a shape and a dig type

Choosing the shape: Using one of the dice, choose one of the pentomino shapes coordinated with that number. There are twelve shapes, with a choice of two shapes with each die-face number.

Choosing the dig type: Using the other die, determine the dig type. There are three dig types.

Example: You roll a 2 and a 5. You can choose one shape, and can choose from four shapes; the two shapes next to the 2 and the two shapes next to the 5. You also have a choice between two dig types; the V from the 2 that was rolled or the diagonal lines from the 5 that was rolled. You decide the best play for your current dig site is to choose the L shape with the 5 die and then use the V dig type with the 2 die.

- Draw shape and fill that shape in with the Dig type
Shapes can be mirrored, turned, and flipped, as long as they are still the same shape.
Shapes can only be placed in open, non-fossil spaces. You can place shapes over the bonus star. If you do, choose and circle one of the bonuses to gain (you can use bonuses in future rounds).

- Check to see if you dig up a Fossil(s) - Once a fossil is completely surrounded orthogonally (up, down, left, right. Not diagonally) then you score that fossil! Circle the number in a lower scoring area that corresponds to the fossil you dug up. If you use all of the same dig type for a fossil, you earn bonus points.

Repeat these steps each round (rolling 2 dice and placing a shape with a dig type) until 20 rounds have been completed.

- Earning Bonus points for using the same Dig Type - if you were able to use the same dig type for a fossil, you also gain the scoring bonus. Circle the extra smaller circle with the +number. If there is more than one dig type used for a fossil, you cannot gain the bonus.

- Bonus Stars - when you place a shape over a bonus star, you gain a bonus! Choose one of the four bonuses at the top-left of the page. The four types of bonuses are One Square Anywhere, Switch Shape, Switch Dig Type, and +1 Point. Each bonus can be gained up to four times in one game.

One Square Anywhere - At any time, place a 1x1 square on any empty square that does not contain a bonus star. Fill in the square (as the dig type). You cannot get the dig type bonus score when a filled-in square is used to dig up that fossil.

Switch Shape - Choose any shape for this round (replacing the one that you would have used)

Switch Dig Type - Choose any dig type for this round (replacing the one that you would have used)

+ 1 Point - Worth one point at the end of the game.

End of Game: After you have completed the 20th roll/round, total your points earned from each fossil dug up, adding in bonuses from fossils dug up with the same dig type, and finally adding points if circled from bonus stars. The player with the most points is the winner!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2020 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Den of the Dead Witch
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All the mothers of Windy Valley are plagued by foul dreams as mining operations uncover a lost level of the dungeons beneath the ruins of the Tempest Mage’s tower. Evil stirs and heroes are called on to reveal its source.

A Two- to Four-Hour D&D Adventurers League Adventure for Tier 1 Characters; optimized for APL 3. Brought to you by Cold Iron Conventions and Fair Play Game Store.

boardgame.name: Quizzles Book 2
boardgame.description:
Quizzles is a family trivia game for 2 to 4 players or teams. Each question in the question booklet is multiple choice. Each player/team rolls a dice and moves their token around the board. The question they answer is based on their token color and position on the game board.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Samurai of Hyuga Jump
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Hyuga, a land with a striking resemblance to Japan. With the squabbling clans of the country having been put to heel the country is at peace and more unified than it has ever been. The increased regulation of blade creation and sword schools has led to the decline of the so-called “Golden Era of Samurai”. But underneath this facade of peace lie old grudges, the sparks of a revolution brought by foreigners and threats that a mere mortal’s blade will not be able to cut down. You arrive in this land in the summer of the Year of the Lion as a certain ronin drinks and waits for their companion in the teahouse known as the Sleeping Duck.

boardgame.name: Dungeons and Dragons: The Dragons
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Sadly, not all dragons are created equal. Racial pricing here is determined largely by the size, inherent natural abilities and advantages of the individual kind of dragon. Do note that while all dragon kinds have strong tendencies towards some sort of behaviour, all dragons are intelligent creatures and any dragon may choose a different path. Therefore, you are not forced into any mental or behavioural patterns by choosing a race here.

boardgame.name: Monster Hunts: Halloween
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Prep yourself for the skeleton war, it's time for some spooktacular Monster Hunts!

Get set to fill your Inns, Taverns, Markets and Bounty Boards with 10 wildly different monster hunting adventures drawn from horror pop culture, from 80s sci fi horrors to 90s cartoon shenanigans and modern horror fiction!

This is a Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition supplement, filled with 10 high-quality quests for characters of all levels

boardgame.name: Monster Hunts: Avernus
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Get those axes ready, it's time for even more Monster Hunts!

Get set to fill your Inns, Taverns, Markets and Bounty Boards with 24 wildly different monster hunting adventures, from Witcher style hunting quests to weird and wonderful searches for the perfect sandwich!

This is a Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition supplement, filled with 24 high-quality quests for characters of all levels.

boardgame.name: Adaptable NPCs: Calamity Edition
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dungeon Masters, immerse players in your post-apocalyptic worlds by bringing your non-player characters to life!

Adaptable NPCs: Calamity contains 41 NPCs with unique statblocks, custom art, and amazingly written lore! They have been crafted with the intention of populating your post-apocalyptic setting, but many would feel right at home in your magitech, technomancy, high-fantasy, or similar worlds.

Additionally, 5 short adventures have been included.

boardgame.name: The Curious Case of The Calm Delilah
boardgame.description:
A Saltmarsh Horror Mini-Campaign

Publisher's blurb:

A Horror Mystery on the High Seas

Set sail with the crew of the Persistent Imperial to uncover the mysteries of The Calm Delilah: a merchant ship that was
last seen leaving Saltmarsh on a secretive expedition many months ago...

Using the waterlogged remains of an old logbook belonging to the Delilah's captain, can the adventurers piece together the events surrounding the ship's untimely disappearance, or will this voyage be their last?

boardgame.name: Tier 1 Monster Hunts
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tier 1 Monster hunts features a collection of brand new creatures from CR 1 - 5, complete with harvesting tables, magical items, and of course - monster hunts!

Whether you're a new DM just learning the ropes, or a grizzled veteran looking to start afresh with a new campaign, Tier 1 Monster Hunts aims to provide you with quick and easy bounties to throw into your taverns, inns, ports and cities quickly and efficiently with minimal prep time. Face off against the deadly and evasive Named One, or fill your players with dread, terror and...confusion? with Anguish, the Jinxed Dragon!

boardgame.name: Chapters-Indigo Pack of 3 Trivia Sets
boardgame.description:
A set of 3 individual quiz packs containing 50 quiz cards each with 2 questions per card. The perfect family pastime, test your knowledge and expand your mind with a little friendly quiz competition!

Featuring three different quiz themes: Canadian Quiz (Do you know which lake Bessie is rumoured to live in?), Festive Quiz (Do you know in which country you would find Lapland?), and General Knowledge Quiz (Do you know what year the first iPhone was released?).

boardgame.name: Wanted: Dead or Alive
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Prison is Empty and All the Criminals are Here
Keep your eyes on the shadows and a hand on your coinpurse, because a cruel crew of criminals have been unleashed on the Realms. This collection of NPCs, created for fifth edition Dungeons & Dragons, brings with them terrifying tales of plots and betrayals - either comitted by them or towards them, depending on who you ask. Brought to you by bestselling DMsGuild authors, Wanted Dead or Alive adds a series of dubious characters that can be used to add some depth to the underbelly of your world.

The criminals can work in any campaign and in any setting, finding ways to circumvent the law despite whatever fantastical powers might be afoot.

boardgame.name: Chapters-Indigo Family Games Night Pack
boardgame.description:
Go head-to-head with this bumper set of quizzes and games for the ultimate night in. Featuring game cards designed with a retro-vibe all held within an easy-to-store wooden box, this set will offer endless hours of entertainment.

Games include: Who Am I? The celebrity guessing game; Charades, the classic miming game; Hum That Tune, the musical humming game; Don't Say A Word, the action-packed describing game; General Knowledge Quiz, the ultimate brain-buster.

boardgame.name: Scientific Secrets of Saltmarsh
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This bestiary was created by a talented team of scientists, researchers, & environmentalists who were inspired by scientific literature to create original monsters that can dropped right into your Ghosts of Saltmarsh campaign or any other aquatic adventure. Each monster is inspired by a fusion of folklore & science and will bring a fresh & engaging new encounter to your table!

boardgame.name: Encounter Icons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A quick reference tool for creature tactics.

Have you ever been frustrated with the seemingly arbitrary CR ratings that are assigned to Dungeons & Dragons creatures and monsters?Do you want a quick and easy visual representation of a monster's abilities? Did you enjoy the creature clarifications in 4th edition Dungeons & Dragons? Then look no further than our Encounter Icons, a visual interpretation of 4th Edition monster classifications, retooled for 5th Edition!

boardgame.name: Librarian Class
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Librarian: an investigative class

Inside this pdf you will find a complete class for playing this Lovecraftian inspired investigator in games of dungeons and dragons 5th edition.

boardgame.name: Combat Overhaul Extended
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

From sword clashing duos to gunfights and magical duels, this extended overhaul grants every character class something new to bring to the table, including a new ruleset for parrying, a destructible cover system and mechanics for contested spellcasting!

A collection of brand new combat features to spice up your Dungeons and Dragons games.

boardgame.name: The Timekeeper
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The timekeeper is an otherworldly patron for warlocks seeking to manipulate the fabric of time, inspired by the creature I created of the same name.

Inside this subclass you will find a collection of new warlock invocations and features for using time-twisting abilities. Wear down your foes with the ravages of time, and manipulate the time around you to bolster your own attacks to better aid your allies in battle.

boardgame.name: Tinkertoy Subrace
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Tinkertoy is an excitable, positive race of gnomes, even by gnomish standards. Often likened to human children after a healthy dose of sugar, Tinkertoys are adventurous, kind spirited individuals that love nothing more than to explore new lands and go on grand journeys.

This well known wanderlust generates a frequent influx of young and old explorers, though other races know well to keep them at arms length - for where there are Tinkertoys, chaos and mayhem are often not far behind...

boardgame.name: 2020 Creator Charity Calendar
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The 2020 Creator Charity Calendar is, yes, an annual calendar for 2020.

However, each page also prominently features a well-known game designer as a cosplay character, complete with game statistics.

boardgame.name: Greatness From Small Beginnings: Level 0
boardgame.description:
"Sometimes the greatest heroes have the most humble origins.
Greatness From Small Beginnings is a comprehensive guide on running a 5th edition campaign of pre-adventuring characters. Watch your characters grow from children to adventurers as they become the heroes the world needs.

Greatness From Small Beginnings Contains:
A step-by-step process for creating a level 0 adventuring party.
The Novus: A new class for level 0 characters.
Snowpeak: A pre-made town designed to function as the centerpiece for the parties' first adventures.
Mentor Characters: A list of 13 pre-made NPCs that can act as mentors to the PCs.
Adversaries: A list of 10 pre-made adversaries designed to challenge (but not kill) a level 0 adventuring party."

(Author Summary)
